repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
I think this'll need a `__Pyx_GOTREF(%s)` (in place of `__Pyx_INCREF` in the others) to pass our tests.

That's a no-op in a regular build, but when running with our "refnanny" tool it helps track the new reference.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3119,19 +3119,46 @@ def generate_next_sequence_item(self, test_name, result_name, code):
             inc_dec = '--'
         else:
             inc_dec = '++'
-        code.putln("#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS")
-        code.putln(
-            "%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(%s, %s); __Pyx_INCREF(%s); %s%s; %s" % (
-                result_name,
-                test_name,
-                self.py_result(),
-                self.counter_cname,
-                result_name,
-                self.counter_cname,
-                inc_dec,
-                # use the error label to avoid C compiler warnings if we only use it below
-                code.error_goto_if_neg('0', self.pos)
-                ))
+        if test_name == 'List':
+            code.putln("#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS && !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")
+            code.putln(
+                "%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(%s, %s); __Pyx_INCREF(%s); %s%s; %s" % (
+                    result_name,
+                    test_name,
+                    self.py_result(),
+                    self.counter_cname,
+                    result_name,
+                    self.counter_cname,
+                    inc_dec,
+                    # use the error label to avoid C compiler warnings if we only use it below
+                    code.error_goto_if_neg('0', self.pos)
+                    ))
+            code.putln("#elif CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS")
+            code.putln(
+                "%s = Py%s_GetItemRef(%s, %s); %s%s; %s" % (

comment_data.body: We usually try to put special cases first just because it's easier if we need to add other special cases.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8409,16 +8436,36 @@ def generate_special_parallel_unpacking_code(self, code, rhs, use_loop):
         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("if (likely(Py%s_CheckExact(sequence))) {" % sequence_types[0])
         for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):
-            code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
-                item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))

+                code.putln("#if !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")

comment_data.body:
This function is new in Py3.13a1 and needs a version guard.
See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/41ca16455188db806bfc7037058e8ecff2755e6c

This function is new in Py3.13a4 and needs a version guard.
See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/d0f1307580a69372611d27b04bbf2551dc85a1ef

That said, rather than repeating the "use GET_ITEM+INCREF or GetItemRef" decision in various places, it seems worth having an inline function that does the equivalent of "GET_ITEM+INCREF" efficiently in different environments.

EDIT: an inline function instead of a macro, because the latter wouldn't allow us to incref before returning the item.
I think this can go, becaise `PyList_GetItemRef` ends up being the same as this when `CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS` isn't defined.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8409,16 +8437,36 @@ def generate_special_parallel_unpacking_code(self, code, rhs, use_loop):
         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("if (likely(Py%s_CheckExact(sequence))) {" % sequence_types[0])
         for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):
-            code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
-                item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+            if sequence_types[0] == "List":
+                code.putln("#if !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.put_incref(item.result(), item.ctype())
+                code.putln("#else")
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GetItemRef(sequence, %d);" % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.putln("#endif")
+            else:  # Tuple
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.put_incref(item.result(), item.ctype())
         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("} else {")
             for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):
-                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
-                    item.result(), sequence_types[1], i))
+                if sequence_types[1] == "List":
+                    code.putln("#if !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")
+                    code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (

comment_data.body: It probably doesn't really matter but I think the change to `CythonFunction.c is unnecessary. We know exactly where the list comes from and only one thread has access to it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1216,15 +1216,17 @@ static int __Pyx_CyFunction_InitClassCell(PyObject *cyfunctions, PyObject *class
 
     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
         __pyx_CyFunctionObject *m = (__pyx_CyFunctionObject *)
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
+#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS && !CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES

comment_data.body: These aren't quite the same from an exception handling point-of-view.

```suggestion
    #if CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX > 0x030d00b1
```

We should base it on the version of the Limited API it's compiled with rather than the version of Python it's compiled with.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,17 +2214,25 @@ static PyObject* __Pyx_PyCode_New(
     }
 
     #if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+    #if CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES && PY_VERSION_HEX > 0x030d00b1

comment_data.body: Would you prefer I revert this change or should we keep it with a comment?
comment_data.diff_hunk:

     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
         __pyx_CyFunctionObject *m = (__pyx_CyFunctionObject *)
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
+#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS && !CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES

comment_data.body:
The smallest change is

```
#if CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d00b1
if (PyDict_GetItemRef(tuple_dedup_map, varnames_tuple, &varnames_tuple_dedup) == -1) goto done;
#endif
```

i.e. only use the result to handle the error case and leave the rest of the logic unchanged.

(Practically of course, exceptions are pretty unlikely here)
It's probably fine to leave I think.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1216,15 +1216,17 @@ static int __Pyx_CyFunction_InitClassCell(PyObject *cyfunctions, PyObject *class
 
     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
         __pyx_CyFunctionObject *m = (__pyx_CyFunctionObject *)
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
+#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS && !CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES

comment_data.body: Don't change this but we only worry about getting the exact version hex for pre-releases versions of older Python versions - we aren't supporting 3.10 betas at this stage so I'd have used `0x030A0000` and called it good enough (and saved a bit of time looking up exactly when it was introduced).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -88,7 +88,28 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx_PyUnicode_FromString(const char*);
 #define __Pyx_PyUnicode_FromOrdinal(o)       PyUnicode_FromOrdinal((int)o)
 #define __Pyx_PyUnicode_AsUnicode            PyUnicode_AsUnicode
 
-#define __Pyx_NewRef(obj) (Py_INCREF(obj), obj)
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON && PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030a00b1

comment_data.body: Totally agree. I'll change it since this was probably a copy paste from somewhere else and I didn't look too closely to see what exact prerelease introduced this.

comment_data.body:
I've created an issue about this https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/6191

It seems to me that users might want to be able to opt back in to the unsafe optimized version. Just using the safe version is probably OK for this PR though

```suggestion
    result = _PyDict_GetItem_KnownHash($moddict_cname, name, ((PyASCIIObject *) name)->hash);
```

I'm going to suggest reverting this. It doesn't apply to Python 3.13 anyway, so and by keeping it the same we don't have to think too hard about changes to error handling.

```suggestion
        return __Pyx_NewRef(result_);
```

Reverting again because Python <3.13

```suggestion
    if (unlikely(__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(result, $moddict_cname, name) == -1)) PyErr_Clear();
```

It looks like this function is just ignoring errors so I'll keep doing that here.

`_PyDict_GetItem_KnownHast` was added back in 3.13.0a2 in https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/112115, so we can remove the version guard if we want. In that case, we'll probably have to keep this in?
Yes keeping it and removing the version-guard makes sense to me.

Could you avoid the duplication by keeping the templating that was here before and conditionally insert `&& !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS` based on the value of `type`? I'm no tempita expert though so take that worth a grain of salt.

```suggestion
            Avoid using APIs that return unsafe "borrowed references" and instead use
            the equivalent APIs that return "strong references". Most useful for
            the free-threaded build of CPython, where incrementing the reference
            count of borrowed references to items in mutable containers might 
            introduce thread safety issues. Borrowed refernces to items in immutable
            containers are still allowed with this setting.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1266,7 +1266,13 @@ hidden by default since most users will be uninterested in changing them.
             a reference to objects it manipulates.  Most useful for
             non-reference-counted implementations of Python, like PyPy
             (where it is enabled by default).
-            
+
+        ``CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS``
+            Avoid using APIs that return "borrowed references" and instead use
+            the equivalent APIs that return "strong references". Most useful for
+            the free-threaded build of CPython, where incrementing the reference
+            count of borrowed references might introduce thread safety issues.

comment_data.body:
Looks like these could both be macros.
```suggestion
#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)  PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)
#define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)  PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
```

Since we're not doing any error checking here, this should depend on `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS` and actually also `!CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS` since we're preferring a borrowed reference over a strong returned reference here.

This is not correct since we've applied a version check above. In older Pythons, the reference will not be increfed.

I'd move the error check + incref into the `#else` block above (and duplicate the error check in the `#if` block).

```suggestion
  #if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON_FREETHREADING
```

We changed the macro just because `nogil` was looking ambiguous with Cython's `nogil` feature in other places
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -308,6 +315,13 @@
   #ifndef CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
     #define CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS 0
   #endif
+  // CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS - Avoid borrowed references that are not thread-safe in the free-threaded build of CPython.
+  #if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON_NOGIL

commit.message: Avoid thread unsafe borrowed references under free-threading
Rename flag to THREAD_UNSAFE and add it to buildenv.pyx
Add GetRef variants and use them instead of get+incref
